name: The Westin Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 day trip to Valencia. We stayed at the Westin and found it extremely convenient. The hotel is only 100 meters from the Metro ( 25 minutes direct on line 5 from the airport or five minutes to the beach). It is about a ten minute walk to the heart of the old town.
reviews.title: Affordable luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very stylish and is designed around a central courtyard with fountain and gardens. Our room was huge by British standards with very comfortable king-size bed. Although there was a busy-ish road outside we could hear no traffic noise.
reviews.title: A Fabulous Vacation

reviews.text: Breakfast, included in our rate ( about 95 euros a night) was a substantial buffet with fresh fruit/juices, cooked dishes and local specialities included. There was even Cava for those who felt the need at 9am.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback was the cost of using the pool. It would have been nice to use the pool for ten minutes at the end of a hot day- but at ten euros a time- no way. It wasn't even a pool you could sit round and sunbathe. It is in the basement and although it looks very pleasant is not somewhere I would want to lounge for long. As an alternative we walked to the beach and hired sunloungers/umbrella for the entire day for 11 euros.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!! Large rooms & wonderful service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware also the cost of drinks- cocktails cost 15 euros!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great service in a somewhat remote location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin Valencia is a class act- just amazing right from the moment of our arrival in the elegant lobby. Very convenient- just a short walk from the Estacion del Norte. We asked for an interior room #222 that overlooked the beautifully landscaped courtyard. Join the free Starwood Preferred Guest program for the better rooms. Our room was quite large with comfortable bed, large windows, huge closet & a bathroom with both a tub on one side & separate shower on the other. Hopefully you'll book this with the all-inclusive breakfast buffet. This is the best we've seen in all of Europe! You certainly won't be disappointed as the attentive staff sees to your every need. Breakfast offers customized personal omelettes, meats, fresh fruits & yogurt, breads, pasrties, the best herbal tea & coffee selection, etc. The business center offers free internet access too. Located in a quieter area a short walk across the Puente de la Exposicion from all the major sites. Use of the pool or gym is an extra fee. Valencia is a charming small town with lots of parks & open spaces.
reviews.title: Wowed by the Westin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely Stunning: beautiful hotel, HUGE beautifully appointed rooms with every modern convenience, and THE BEST BREAKFAST i have ever had in a hotel (seriously).
reviews.title: Simply EXCELLENT in every respect.

reviews.text: Tips: get your internet and parking and breakfast included in the room rate.
reviews.title: Just perfect....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great staff, incredible rooms, probably the best hotel i have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Good hotel for a small holiday in Valencia

reviews.text: Everything about The Westin Valencia is wonderful - location (15 mins from airport and 15 mins walk to centre of old city), rooms (huge and equipped to 5 star standards), amenities (including bars, restaurant, business centre and a tranquil terrace) and staff (most helpful, courteous and yet friendly). We loved this hotel (and Valencia!) and will definitely be back!!!
reviews.title: 5star luxury at 4 star prices!!

reviews.text: The Westin deserves its 5 star rating. It is a converted building of character with a super quiet courtyard garden close to the town center but in a quiet location. The rooms are large and well furnished with the beds up to the usual Westin standards.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in excellent location.

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, quiet garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been at this hotel with my family. Room was large and was perfect for us and our two children. Garden is very quiet and taking a refreshment there after a long day is perfect. Center and the City of Arts and Sciences are not close by but are at a 'walkable' distance.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived for a 2 night stay and were immediately upgraded to a large King Room with walled terrace. The location was good for us, away from the busy centre so it was nice and quiet and the old town was only 20 minutes walk. The hotel is set around a lovely tranquil courtyard with shrubs and fountains. We were happy also to note proper doors on both the bathroom and the separate WC, we have found these lacking in many 'boutique' hotels. Reception staff were exceptionally helpful as were the Breakfast staff. Would be happy to recommend this hotel to our friends. Our only problem was that the pillows were too soft and the additional 'bolsters' provided were no better, but that's just a personal thing.
reviews.title: Very good stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a midweek stay at the Westin.
reviews.title: excellent, great garden for dinner

reviews.text: As a Platinium Member and a big fan of nice hotels around the world, I was very excited to visit the Westin Valencia. When going to the website, the pictures are stunning. When we arrived; the streets around the hotel were desertic (august i guess), however the hotel (which is set in an old building which looks like a prison) has been very well refurbished. The general manager greeted me at check in and we got upgraded to a junior suite, which was a HUGE room which looked like a living room, with separate bath,shower... got fruits, chocolates, water for free.
reviews.title: Nice and modern Hotel, No Concierge!

reviews.text: The gym is stunning, we really enjoyed the indoor swimming pool, although wearing a headcap is not very sexy! I wish they had an outdoor swimming pool instead.
reviews.title: Perhaps a 5-star hotel but no 5-star service

reviews.text: The hotel looks very nice throughout the main area, the inside garden is beautifully maintained, however we wished they had a sunday brunch where you could spend time and enjoy the settings.
reviews.title: Nice, but a bit uneven

reviews.text: Overall a very nice property, got a very low rate via Expedia (100 euro), which made it cheaper than using SPG points. I would recommend this hotel if staying in Valencia (which is beautiful), seems to be the only 5 star hotel there.
reviews.title: Absolutly fantastic hotel

reviews.text: First the positive points;
reviews.title: Bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lot has been said about this hotel, most of which we'd absolutely agree with; a fantastic Art-Deco building which has been sympathetically restored, brilliant Spa (truly excellent service), superb rooms....and all in a convenient location.
reviews.title: Great hotel - lacks a little polish

reviews.text: There were a few areas that could still have a little polish added...most importantly in the Reception/Concierge service. We arrived at reception (having being ignored by the bellboy) with our 2 large suitcases - the (only) receptionist was on the phone and made no effort to make eye contact with us or terminate the call. After check-in, we had to wheel our own luggage to the room - no offer of assistance.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not rate "value" because i used SPG points to stay there. i was an amazing facility and amazing room. very very nice. actually the nicest SPG we have staying in. we stayed at the Westing in Madrid and this was sooooooo much nicer. 10 minute walk to the old town section so not bad but would have been nicer to be in center of town. for free though i just could not complain.
reviews.title: awesome hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is perfect. The location is great. 15minute walk to the old town. 5 mins to Metro , two stops to Colon for Shopping. Little further to the beach... on the metro. Beach is great, long and clean. Pay 11euro for two beds and an umbrella. Breakfast in the hotel is served until 11 and the choice is great. Staff were so friendly nothing was too much trouble. Room was huge, huge bed etc. We had complimentary access to the spa / pool area. Beautiful garden courtyard area to relax and have a drink or watch world cup/wimbledon. Bit expensive 8euro for a milkshake . We asked for a late checkout and got the room for full day for 80euro which we felt was very worth it as we had the full day at the beach came back, showered , packed and went to airport at 6.30 in the evening. I loved this hotel and will definately be back . Valencia itself is a beautiful city , old and so nice to sit in the square and people watch. Get the metro to the airport 2.90 euro takes about 20mins. If using the metro, you can get a 1,2 or 3 day pass for 10euro - well worth it for unlimted use of metro, trams and bus. Also can be recharged on the machines for extra days if needed. Really handy.
reviews.title: Loves it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were delighted with every aspect of this hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were enormous and quiet. We had a huge shower and tub and separate room for the toilet. More closet space than in our own house!The staff was extremely courteous and helpful in answering any travel-related question we asked. We dined at one of the restaurants and the food was incredible. We walked in to the restaurant even after they had closed and they still offered to feed us without even the slightest attitude for making them stay longer! The hotel has a beautiful courtyard with modern furnishings. Everything was very posh about this hotel....except the price. An excellent value for the price.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel with incredible amenities

reviews.text: Since my parents visited serveral STARWOOD hotels, (Sevilla, Marrakech, Munich), and always were very satisfied, we (my husband, me and our 1 year old daughter) decided to book one night in The Westin Valencia.
reviews.title: Never accept room # 152

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And I must admit , our first impression was "EXELLENT"
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This fine property provides all the luxury and service one expects from top-tier Westins while also offering a boutique feel in a heritage building, and as others have commented, the desk staff was quick to grant an SPG Gold Upgrade, which is always appreciated and far from a given across Starwoods.
reviews.title: One of Westin's Finest in One of Spain's Best Cities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The trip in from the airport is a snap on the Metro and I found exiting the Aragon station to be a few steps fewer and generally easier, with a 3 minute walk to the hotel. Between the Aragon station and the hotel there is a handy and very inexpensive supermarket named "Consum", which is ideal for bottled water and travel snacks. While it is true that few things of interest are near the hotel, most are accessible by foot or the metro, and being a bit away allows for a very hushed environment, which is also not a given in European city hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: Between the City of Arts and Sciences, the historic core and its excellent museums, the World Cup site, and the beach, Valencia merits 3 days, or longer if you just want to enjoy the pleasant vibe and relaxed pace Valencia offers.
reviews.title: Great Stay will go back again!

reviews.text: Enjoy the Heavenly Bed, Heavenly Bath, beautiful courtyard, and great service!
reviews.title: Westin Valencia Welcomes

reviews.text: Stayed at The Westin Valencia for three days/two nights. First of all, the hotel is a very quick metro ride from the Valencia Norde station, which was hugely convenient. Even though check-in was not until 2 pm, the staff was able to prepare a room for us by noon. The hotel itself is smaller than most Westin's, but the room was quite spacious. Other than the convenient location, the best part of the hotel was the concierge. They were hugely helpful in helping us identify the best biking/walking routes to different parts of Valencia, figuring out efficient transportation around the city and making dinner reservations. Even though the hotel offers bike rentals directly, the concierge directed us to a bike rental nearby that was cheaper. My only issue was with the food options in the hotel ( extremely limited).
reviews.title: proximity

reviews.text: We have just returned from the fabulous Westin Valencia. We booked via directline city breaks, we went with another couple and we were both celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary's. The hotel kindly upgraded our rooms for a small charge and made our stay one to remember. We ate at the hotel on the 1st evening.. They had decorated our table with rose petals and flowers, a beautiful touch. The meal was excellent as were the beautiful breakfasts each day. They held a wedding reception on the Saturday evening which was absolutely beautiful.. Like a scene from a movie! I could go on and on! The only criticism I would have about the whole place were the young girls serving in the evening 'cocktail bar' area.. They were quite rude and miserable which was a shame as all the other staff were fantastic. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone.. Infact you must go!!
reviews.title: Fantastico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Westin Valencia is perfectly situated for exploring the old town and for shopping. It's a 15 minute walk to the Plaza del Reina and the Cathedral. It is served well by 2 Metro stations both within a 5 minute walk. Alameda station is perfect for travel to and from the airport and Aragon station is idela to get the metro/tram to the beautiful beach.
reviews.title: We loved it and will definitley be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff and concierge are friendly and informative and will help with any question. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary we were given an upgrade to a Grand Deluxe Room which was superb and we received a very nice card and cake on the day. The Jardin del Turia is beautiful and its a lovely 20-30minute walk to the Arts and Sciences museum which is spectacular.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and cant wait to return.

reviews.text: Before I start I will say that the only thing that we didn't like about this hotel was the fact that we had to leave!
reviews.title: A Touch of Class

reviews.text: The Westin is a quality 5 star hotel with fantastic staff, good quality rooms, and excellent breakfast. The location is very central and you can walk to most of the main attractions within about 15 minutes.
reviews.title: We would have loved to stay longer
Very good but some small disappointments
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and got an amazing deal on a deluxe double from Octopustravel (£200 in total including breakfasts!) so for that price it was perfect. However, if I had paid the going rate (about £700 without breakfast) then certain things would have irritated us. The receptionist was perfectly pleasant but didn't show/point us in the direction of our room and there was no one in the foyer at that moment to show us. As we were on the ground floor we walked off in various directions but couldn't find any signage showing the rooms. When we went back to reception, we were taken to the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room safe didn't work so when we queried this, they said that none of the safes on the ground floor work (!) but we could use the safety deposit box at reception which we declined. Maybe we were given that room because of the rate we paid. At the very least they could have put a notice up to tell us. The room was quite dark but huge bed with lovely luxurious cotton sheets.
reviews.title: Impossible to fault

reviews.text: The bathroom was very nice with huge walk in shower and bath and separate toilet. Apart from the basic toiletries of shampoo/conditioner/body lotion there was no shower cap, cotton wool, emery board etc which I would expect to see as standard in a 5* hotel. It was possible to get a range of items from Customer Relations but I assume they would charge for these things.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Valencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great - hubby enjoyed the omlettes cooked to order - not sure we would have paid the 25 Euros each (or whatever the cost) but again fantastic as it was included.
reviews.title: 5 Star Hotel With great rooms and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location (not in the centre but about 10 min walk to old town). Direct metro line to airport (took about 25 mins). I am not usually this picky when reviewing hotels but then we don't usually stay in 5* luxury establishments. As I said - fantastic value for what we paid but feel it would have fallen short of expecations if paying 4 times the price!
reviews.title: Beautiful 5* hotel - ideal for a chilled city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really lovely, clean, polished hotel. Breakfast was great, fresh food.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.text: Only annoying thing was you had to pay 10euro to us the pool.
reviews.title: Professional and elegant

reviews.text: Great for business or pleasure, we had a really spacious room.
reviews.title: Great, but a few small problems

reviews.text: I get married there and everything was perfect.The rooms are big,amazing bed and nice bathroom. We had a terrace with a jacuzzi outside.Silence rooms. If football players from Barcelona choose this hotel... Has to be top!!
reviews.title: An excellent choice

reviews.text: This hotel is nothing short of beautiful. The food at the restaurant in the courtyard is very good. The rooms are elegant, huge and beautifully appointed.
reviews.title: Great staff, great rooms, great location!

description: Welcome to the exclusive The Westin Valencia, 5* G.L. Located in the city center in an impressive historic building, it is the ideal choice to discover the city and enjoy a exquisite atmosphere. It offers 135 confortable rooms and suites, with Westin Heavenly Beds, restaurants, meeting rooms, bars, wellness center and Mediterranean gardens.
